bold.description: Use for important text such as headers, titles and important information

default.description: Use for text to indicate new or recently modified information to users.

subtle.description: Use for text that require subtle emphasis to indicate new or recently modified information to users.

subtlest.description: Use for secondary text such as description, navigation, subtle button links, input field labels, and all caps subheadings.

default.description: Use for normal text such as body copy, paragraph and neutral buttons.

inverse.description: Use for text that require a lighter color to ensure visibility and contrast on bold backgrounds

disabled.description: Use for text in a disabled or inactive state of the element

level1.description: Use for actionable elements that are to provide a subtle yet noticeable separation from the main content such as main CTA Buttons, Navigation Bars

level2.description: Use for elements that temporarily rise above others during interactions, signaling an active or dynamic state such as draging an item or hover state of cards

level3.description: Use for floating elements that have a connection to the layout itself, usually an extension to a layout item.E.g. popover lists (Select, Dropdown, etc.), floating panels (Color picker, Date-time picker), Tooltips, FAB etc.

level4.description:
Use for floating elements that are not part of the layout, and fully detached from it.
E.g. Dialogs, Snack Bars, floating Notifications, Steps bar, etc.

level4_soft.description: Use for cards,widgets or tables as a way to provide additional hierarchy or emphasis and differentiate from other elements.

label.description: Use for line height of the text elements that serve as labels, providing clear and concise information

heading1.description: Use for line height of the most prominent headings to create catchy titles, specifically apply for text with font size "heading1"

heading2.description: Use for line height of the secondary headings that are slightly less prominent than the main title, specifically apply for text with font size "heading2"

heading3.description: Use for line height of the headings that require the highest level of emphasis within Enable's products, specifically apply for text with font size "heading3"

heading4.description: Use for line height of the headings that require a significant level of emphasis within Enable's products, specifically apply for text with font size "heading4"

heading5.description: Use for line height of the headings that require a less level of emphasis within Enable's products, specifically apply for text with font size "heading5"

heading6.description: Use for line height of the least prominent headings, suitable for the smallest sections or specific points within detailed content, specifically apply for text with font size "heading6"

body1.description: Use for line height of the biggest body text that requires more emphasis than the default body text, specifically apply for text with font size "body1"

body2.description: Use for line height of the primary body text, ensuring clear readability and consistency, specifically apply for text with font size "body2"

body3.description: Use for line height of the secondary body text, which needs to be less prominent than default body text, specifically apply for text with font size "body3"

body4.description: Use for line height  of the text elements that need subtle emphasis, supporting other body text elements,specifically apply for text with font size "body4"

body5.description: Use for line height of the least prominent body text which is in data-heavy layouts and small components, specifically apply for text with font size "body5"

caption1.description: Use for line height of the text elements that are in all capital letters, providing primary captions with clear and subtle emphasis specifically apply for text with font size "caption1"

caption2.description: Use for line height of the text elements that are in all capital letters, providing secondary captions with clear and subtle emphasis specifically apply for text with font size "caption2"

sm.description: Use for line height of the text elements of the button component

md.description: Use for line height of the text elements of the button component

heading1.description: Use for font size of the most prominent headings to make catchy titles, such as main titles on landing page

heading2.description: Use for font size of the secondary headings that are slightly less prominent than the main title such as secondary titles on landing page

heading3.description: Use for font size of the headings that require the highest level of emphasis within Enable's products, such as page titles or important headers within sections

heading4.description: Use for font size of the headings that require a significant level of emphasis within Enable's products, such as page titles or headers within sections

heading5.description: Use for font size of the headings that require a less level of emphasis within Enable's products, such as feature title or tab title

heading6.description: Use for font size to the least prominent headings, suitable for the smallest sections or specific points within detailed content such as heading of tabs

body1.description:
"Use for font size of the primary body text, ensuring clear readability and consistency such as main paragraphs
Descriptive text and Long-form content"

body2.description:

body3.description: Use for font size of the secondary body text, which needs to be less prominent than default body text such as meta data descriptions, breadcrumps

body4.description: Use for font size of the text elements that need subtle emphasis, supporting other body text elements such as description text under secondary body text

body5.description: Use for the font size of the least prominent body text which is in data-heavy layouts and small components, such as chips,
